newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midwest direct hog prices off $0.50 - dealers.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midwest direct hog prices off $0.50 - dealers.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct cash hogs Wednesday sold $0.50 per cwt lower amid light packer demand and adequate hog supplies, livestock dealers said.
Interior Iowa and southern Minnesota hogs sold early at $46.00 to $47.00 in the country and $47.50 to $48.50 at plants, sources there said.
Illinois hogs sold at $46.50 to $47.50 in the country and $48.00 to $48.50 at plants.
Indiana hogs sold at $46.50 to $47.00 in the country and $47.00 to $47.50 at plants. Ohio hogs sold at $44.00 to $45.00 in the country and $46.00 to $47.00 at plants.
Hefty hog marketings on Tuesday reportedly provided packers with plenty of hogs to get through most of Wednesday, curbing packers' interest in buying early, sources said.
Outlooks for continued large hog supplies Wednesday also weighed on cash prices, they said.
Weak pork demand lent further price softness as retailers continued to focus on beef purchases for post-Easter advertising promotions, sources said.
Wholesale pork prices were mixed on Tuesday, with loins and hams lower and pork bellies higher. Pork cut-out values were quoted unchanged for all carcass grades, USDA reported.
